edu.stanford.ramcloud

Class RAMCloud

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.ramcloud.RAMCloud

  • public class RAMCloud
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides Java bindings for RAMCloud. Right now it is a rather simple subset of what RamCloud.h defines. Running ``javah'' on this file will generate a C header file with the appropriate JNI function definitions. The glue interfacing to the C++ RAMCloud library can be found in RAMCloud.cc. For JNI information, the IBM tutorials and Android developer docs are much better than Sun's at giving an overall intro: http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/java/tutorials/j-jni/section4.html http://developer.android.com/training/articles/perf-jni.html

    • Constructor Detail

      • RAMCloud

        public RAMCloud(java.lang.String locator,
        java.lang.String clusterName)
        Construct a RAMCloud for a particular cluster.
        Parameters:
        locator - Describes how to locate the coordinator. It can have either of two forms. The preferred form is a locator for external storage that contains the cluster configuration information (such as a string starting with "zk:", which will be passed to the ZooStorage constructor). With this form, sessions can automatically be redirected to a new coordinator if the current one crashes. Typically the value for this argument will be the same as the value of the "-x" command-line option given to the coordinator when it started. The second form is deprecated, but is retained for testing. In this form, the location is specified as a RAMCloud service locator for a specific coordinator. With this form it is not possible to roll over to a different coordinator if a given one fails; we will have to wait for the specified coordinator to restart.
        clusterName - Name of the current cluster. Used to allow independent operation of several clusters sharing many of the same resources. This is typically the same as the value of the "--clusterName" command-line option given to the coordinator when it started.

      • getRejectRulesBytes

        public static byte[] getRejectRulesBytes(RejectRules rules)
        Returns a byte array representing the given RejectRules value.
        Parameters:
        rules - RejectRules object to convert to a byte array.
        Returns:
        A byte array representation of the given RejectRules, or null if the given RejectRules was null.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnect from the RAMCloud cluster. This causes the JNI code to destroy the underlying RAMCloud C++ object.

      • finalize

        public void finalize()
        This method is called by the garbage collector before destroying the object. The user really should have called disconnect, but in case they did not, be sure to clean up after them.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object

      • read

        public RAMCloudObject read(long tableId,
                  java.lang.String key,
                  RejectRules rules)
        Read the current contents of an object.
        See Also:
        read(long, byte[], edu.stanford.ramcloud.RejectRules)

      • read

        public RAMCloudObject read(long tableId,
                  byte[] key,
                  RejectRules rules)
        Read the current contents of an object.
        Parameters:
        tableId - The table containing the desired object (return value from a previous call to getTableId).
        key - Variable length key that uniquely identifies the object within tableId. It does not necessarily have to be null terminated. The caller must ensure that the storage for this key is unchanged through the life of the RPC.
        rules - If non-NULL, specifies conditions under which the read should be aborted with an error.
        Returns:
        A RAMCloudObject holding the key, value, and version of the read object.

        public long remove(long tableId,

        See Also:

      • remove

        public long remove(long tableId,
          byte[] key,
          RejectRules rules)
        Delete an object from a table. If the object does not currently exist then the operation succeeds without doing anything (unless rejectRules causes the operation to be aborted).
        Parameters:
        tableId - The table containing the object to be deleted (return value from a previous call to getTableId).
        key - Variable length key that uniquely identifies the object within tableId.
        rules - If non-NULL, specifies conditions under which the delete should be aborted with an error.
        Returns:
        The version number of the object (just before deletion).

      • write

        public long write(long tableId,
         byte[] key,
         byte[] value,
         RejectRules rules)
        Replace the value of a given object, or create a new object if none previously existed.
        Parameters:
        tableId - The table containing the desired object (return value from a previous call to getTableId).
        key - Variable length key that uniquely identifies the object within tableId.
        value - String providing the new value for the object.
        rules - If non-NULL, specifies conditions under which the write should be aborted with an error.
        Returns:
        The version number of the object is returned. If the operation was successful this will be the new version for the object. If the operation failed then the version number returned is the current version of the object, or 0 if the object does not exist.

      • createTable

        public long createTable(java.lang.String name,
               int serverSpan)
        Create a new table, if it doesn't already exist.
        Parameters:
        name - Name for the new table.
        serverSpan - The number of servers across which this table will be divided (defaults to 1). Keys within the table will be evenly distributed to this number of servers according to their hash. This is a temporary work-around until tablet migration is complete; until then, we must place tablets on servers statically.
        Returns:
        The return value is an identifier for the created table; this is used instead of the table's name for most RAMCloud operations involving the table.

      • createTable

        public long createTable(java.lang.String name)
        Create a new table, if it doesn't already exist.
        Parameters:
        name - Name for the new table.
        Returns:
        The return value is an identifier for the created table; this is used instead of the table's name for most RAMCloud operations involving the table.

      • dropTable

        public void dropTable(java.lang.String name)
        Delete a table. All objects in the table are implicitly deleted, along with any other information associated with the table. If the table does not currently exist then the operation returns successfully without actually doing anything.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the table to delete.

      • getTableId

        public long getTableId(java.lang.String name)
        Given the name of a table, return the table's unique identifier, which is used to access the table.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the desired table.
        Returns:
        The return value is an identifier for the table; this is used instead of the table's name for most RAMCloud operations involving the table.

      • getTableIterator

        public TableIterator getTableIterator(long tableId)
        Returns a new TableIterator for the specified table.
        Parameters:
        tableId - The ID of the table to enumerate.
        Returns:
        An Iterator that will enumerate the specified table's objects.
